neurological: Complex nervous system with approximately 500 million neurons
Decentralized neural processing with semi-autonomous arms
behavioral: Exhibits wound guarding (protective behavior when injured)
physiological: Shows avoidance learning after painful stimuli
Altered behavior patterns after noxious experiences

sentience_confidence_justification: Multiple strong indicators across neurological, behavioral, and physiological categories
welfare_requirements: Adequate space for movement and exploration
If used for food: humane slaughter methods required
Social consideration: generally solitary but needs stimulation
protection_rationale: High sentience confidence based on extensive evidence

sources.citation: Crook, R.J. (2014). The welfare of invertebrate animals in research. ILAR Journal.
Mather, J.A., & Dickel, L. (2017). Cephalopod complex cognition. Current Opinion in Behavioral Sciences.
Birch, J. et al. (2021). Review of the Evidence of Sentience in Cephalopod Molluscs. LSE Report.
